DataElement.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Prognostic Factor Classification Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the Motzer classification of general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a renal cell carcinoma, a carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma, and its eventual outcome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Prognostic Factor Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the classification or systematic arrangement of general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a renal cell carcinoma, a carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma, and its eventual outcome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that develops in the lining of the renal tubules, which filter the blood and produce urine.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma.  There is a strong correlation between cigarette smoking and the development of renal cell carcinoma.  The clinical presentation includes : hematuria, flank pain and a palpable lumbar mass.  A high percentage of renal cell carcinomas are diagnosed when an ultrasound is performed for other purposes.  Radical nephrectomy is the standard intervention procedure.  Renal cell carcinoma is generally considered to be resistant to radiation treatment and chemotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Prognostic Factor Status
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the prognostic factor status for renal cell carcinoma.
